missionProperties.missionDescription: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign. ==== Tress's father used to tell the wildest stories of his days smuggling spice all over the Outer Rim. She remembers his bravado... and his obsessive need to record and protect every clever hyperroute he ever used. Though he is gone, these navigational records could help Rebel smugglers, but to get it, Tress will have to return to a home of which she has only bad memories.
missionProperties.additionalMissionInfo: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

The Hacnua lodge is overgrown and collapsed from disrepair. You see signs that the local wildlife have made the ruins their home. You hope the smuggler’s navchip has survived the years more intact than the structure.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.

eventActions.tbText: The forest is overgrown with long vines hanging from the canopy.

{-} Neutral mission tokens represent vines. A CREATURE can climb vines when instructed.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Hacnua lodge opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent vines. A CREATURE can climb vines when instructed.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Hacnua lodge opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
Thoroughly beaten, the beast retreats into the trees. You see the navchip in the mud and scoop it up as you head for your shuttle, knowing the smuggling routes it contains will save many Rebel ships.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
More creatures slink from the forest around you, teeth gnashing. Your injuries are already severe enough that you know you can't win this fight. The creatures croon triumphantly as you retreat to your ship; the valuable data on the navchip is lost,

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
An Imperial cruiser moves to intercept your ship as you leave Devaron. Your scanners pick up TIE fighters launching. You punch one of the smugglers routes into your navicomputer. As TIEs rake fire across your shields, you jump to hyperspace — and safety.

You meet the Ghost at your rendezvous point. “Not a moment too soon,” says Kanan. “These will help us slip past Imperial patrols throughout the sector. Some of our friends have gone without resupply for too long.”

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.

eventActions.mainText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign 1: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Ezra Bridger / Kanan Jarrus Ally Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 2: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with Sabine Wren / Zeb Orrelios Ally Pack Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 3: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with both Ally Packs.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any of the above Ally Packs.

events.eventText:
You collapse in your bunk battered, exhausted, and with nothing to show for your excursion to Devaron but an understanding of how lethal the galaxy can be.

You rendezvous with the Ghost days later. Hera looks like she hasn't slept since you saw her last. “The Empire’s stepping up patrols. We're losing ground.”

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.

eventActions.mainText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign 1: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Ezra Bridger / Kanan Jarrus Ally Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 2: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with Sabine Wren / Zeb Orrelios Ally Pack Pack.
{-} Extended campaign 3: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with both Ally Packs.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any of the above Ally Packs.

events.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

“We're keeping our heads down,” Hera tells you. “What we most need now is something to distract Thrawn.”

You contact your Lothal informant, the droid N-4M, who is happy to hear from you — at least, as happy as an analyst droid can be. “You have been causing the local garrison some discomfort. They are preparing for the possibility of a larger Rebel strike.”

N-4M shifts its holodisplay to focus on Lothal’s surface. “The Empire is driving their forced labor harder than ever. One officer in particular, Colonel Xarok, is quickly gaining a reputation for his particularly... aggressive practices.”

{-} The next active mission is “Executive Overreach” (Ezra & Kanan Ally Pack).

“We're keeping our heads down,” Hera tells you. “What we most need now is something to distract Thrawn.”

You contact your Lothal informant, the droid N-4M, who is happy to hear from you — at least, as happy as an analyst droid can be. “You have been causing the local garrison some discomfort. They are preparing for the possibility of a larger Rebel strike.”

N-4M pulls up a diagram of Imperial supply routes leading to Lothal. “Several Wookiee laborers recently rebelled at a labor camp directly connected to Thrawn's activities. Their uprising failed, and the Empire is now threatening reprisal against their families. Perhaps you could intervene on the Wookiees’ behalf.”

{-} The next active mission is “Intimidation Factor” (Sabine & Zeb Ally Pack).

“We're keeping our heads down,” Hera tells you. “What we most need now is something to distract Thrawn.”

You contact your Lothal informant, the droid N-4M, who is happy to hear from you — at least, as happy as an analyst droid can be. “You have been causing the local garrison some discomfort. They are preparing for the possibility of a larger Rebel strike.”

N-4M shifts its holodisplay to focus on Lothal’s surface. “The Empire is driving their forced labor harder than ever. One officer in particular, Colonel Xarok, is quickly gaining a reputation for his particularly... aggressive practices.”

N-4M pulls up a diagram of Imperial supply routes leading to Lothal. “Several Wookiee laborers recently rebelled at a labor camp directly connected to Thrawn's activities. Their uprising failed, and the Empire is now threatening reprisal against their families. Perhaps you could intervene on the Wookiees’ behalf.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to attack Colonel Xarok or help the Wookiees.
{-} If the heroes choose to attack Colonel Xarok, the next active mission is “Executive Overreach” (Ezra & Kanan Ally Pack).
{-} If the heroes choose to help the Wookiees, the next active mission is “Intimidation Factor” (Sabine & Zeb Ally Pack).

Aboard the Ghost, you find Hera and Sabine scrutinizing the remains of an E-XD infiltrator droid. “We've found more than one of these things trying to follow us lately,’" Hera says. “And Thrawn isn't letting up. We need to even the odds.”

“So we give them something else to worry about,” suggests Sabine. “Even if it only ties up some stormtroopers. We didn't get to stay on Geonosis long enough for me to check, but I think we might be able to get some of those old battle droids working.”

“Or,” Hera puts in, “we can try to help the Twi'lek rebels on Ryloth. The Empire’s been intercepting their supplies for a while now. If we can help them put up more of a fight, that will be one more thing for Thrawn to worry about.”

{-} The heroes collectively choose whether to check out the droid factory or assist the Twi'lek rebels.
{-} If the heroes choose to check out the droid factory, the next active mission is “Siege on Geonosis”.
{-} If the heroes choose to assist the Twi'lek rebels, the next active mission is “Race on Ryloth”.
The door to the lodge swings open and reveals a dilapidated interior.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The old door to the Hacnua lodge looks weathered, but intact.

eventActions.tbText: Another vine hangs through the broken ceiling.
A loth-cat gnaws on the remains of a navchip. It cocks its head and takes the navchip in its jaws.

{-} The blue Rebel mission token represents the navchip.
{-} The first <color="red">Loth-cat</color> deployed interrupts to retrieve the navchip and gains 1 {g}.
{-} The mission will progress when the <color="red">Loth-cat</color> carrying the navchip is defeated. When this happens, click the Entrance and select "Loth-cat defeated".

translatedEntityProperties.theText: When the <color="red">Loth-cat</color> carrying the navchip is defeated, click "Loth-cat defeated".

eventActions.repositionText: Block access to the <color="red">Loth-cat</color> carrying the navchip.

eventActions.shortText: Chase and defeat the <color="red">Loth-cat</color> carrying the navchip.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent vines. A CREATURE can climb vines when instructed.
{-} The mission will progress when the <color="red">Loth-cat</color> carrying the navchip is defeated. When this happens, click the Entrance and select "Loth-cat defeated".
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
The <color="red">Loth-cat</color> carrying the navchip resolves the following instructions:

{-} NINE LIVES: This figure's attacks gain Recover 2 {H}.

{Q} POUNCE: Place this figure in an empty space within 6 spaces and adjacent to {rebel}. Then, attack {rebel}.
{A} CATCH ME IF YOU CAN: Move 3 to climb a vine. Discard this vine and place this figure on the space of the other vine that is the most spaces away from the Rebels. Then, discard the second vine.
{A} Move 6 away from the Rebels.
{A} Move 4 away from the Rebels.
{-} FRESH CATCH: This figure gains 1 {g} and 1 {h}.

{-} SCAREDY-CAT: After this figure's activation, the closest Rebel may test {J}. If it does not pass, this figure moves 6 away from the Rebels and gains 1 {f}.

After that, the other <color="red">Loth-cat</color> (if still alive) activates as usual.

The creature starts shrieking. With a rustle of leaves, a huge, scarred nexu drops from the trees. The frightened loth-cat climbs atop it, the navchip still in its jaws, as the nexu bares its teeth protectively.

eventActions.customText:
{-} OLD GRUDGE: This figure gains 1 {h}.
{A}{A} If this figure has suffered 6 or more {H}, recover 4 {H}. Then, move 10 away from the Rebels.
{Q} POUNCE: Place this figure in an empty space within 6 spaces and adjacent to 2 or more Rebels. Then attack {rebel}.
{Q} POUNCE: Place this figure in an empty space within 6 spaces and adjacent to {rebel}. Then attack {rebel}.
{A} CATCH ME IF YOU CAN: Move 3 to interact with a vine. Discard this vine and place this figure on the space of the other vine that is the most spaces away from the Rebels. Then, discard the second vine.
 {A} Move 4 away from the Rebels.
 {A} Move 10 away from the Rebels.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} Deploy the <color="red">Nexu</color> to the space the defeated <color="red">Loth-cat</color> just occupied.
{-} Apply additional Health to the <color="red">Nexu</color> equal to twice the threat level. 
{-} The <color="red">Nexu</color> loses “Non-Sentient.”
{-} The <color="red">Nexu</color> interrupts to retrieve the navchip.
{-} The Rebels win when the <color="red">Nexu</color> is defeated.
Alerted by the commotion, more enemies rush in.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent vines. A CREATURE can climb vines when instructed.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Hacnua lodge opens.
{-} The Rebels win when the <color="red">Nexu</color> is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: Tress’ shoulder tingles with painful memory as she recognizes the nexu. She raises her durasteel-plated fist. “Ready for a rematch?”
Tress Hacnua receives the “Wholeness” Reward card.
The heroes receive 150 credits per hero.

mapEntities.mainText: The old door to the Hacnua lodge looks weathered, but intact.
